author: boston.com
title: This video about Boston winter is very un-winter-like - Local news
text:
After last year’s record-breaking “snowmaggedon,” Boston fears winter tourism will suffer.
“We had started to hear that people didn’t want to come to Boston [this winter],” Beth Stehley, the Greater Boston Convention and Visitors Bureau’s vice president of convention sales and services told The Boston Globe .
Enter the above video, “Boston ... Bring it on!” The video, which aims to lure meeting planners to Boston this winter, is emceed by Boston comedian Jimmy Tingle and features Mayor Martin J. Walsh, Governor Charlie Baker, Ed Freni, Massport’s director of aviation, and others. They all tout Boston’s restaurants, attractions, amenities, transportation, and people.
 The goal, according to Eric Cox, the video’s producer, was to address “the elephant in the room,” he told the Globe .
But the video shows pleasant weather throughout — sailboats on the Boston Harbor, blue skies and dry ground at Fenway Park, and people frolicking in fountains along the Greenway. Frolicking. In fountains.
Why no images of a twinkling Faneuil Hall during the Christmas tree lighting or ice skaters gliding on Boston Common’s scenic Frog Pond?
Cox, director of video services at Regan Communications, told the Globe his team went “back and forth” during the creative process about whether to show snow and ultimately decided “we don’t have to show it. People know what snow looks like.”
Read more in the Globe .
